citation.article-title: Fermentation of maleate by a Gram-negative strictly anaerobic non-spore-former, Propionivibrio dicarboxylicus gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Propionivibrio dicarboxylicus sp. nov.
Propionivibrio dicarboxylicus (di.car.bo.xy'li.cus. M.L.adj. dicarboxylicus pertaining to dicarboxylic acid)
Curved to helical rod, 1.0-2.0 μm by 0.5-0.6 μm.
The ends are tapered and rounded to give cashew nut- or kidney-shaped cells.
Motile in an active tumbling manner with a single polar flagellum.
Nitrate, sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate, and elemental sulfur not reduced.
Maleate, fumarate, and L-malate utilized as energy- and carbon-sources, forming propionate and acetate as end-products.
Not utilized: acetoin, acrylate, corn oil, crotonate, formate, glycerol, H2/C02 plus acetate, lactate, peptone, pyruvate, yeast extract, monosaccharides, disaccharides, trisaccharides.
pH-Range: pH 6.2-7.1, optimum near pH 6.7, no growth at pH 7.6.
Temperature-range: 26- 34, optimum at 30°C, no growth at 20°C and 40°C.
DNA base ratio: 61 mol% G + C (HPLC).
Habitats: anaerobic mud of freshwater sediments.
Type strain: CreMal1, deposited in the Japan Collection of Mikroorganisms, Wako, Japan, and in Deutsche Sammlung yon Mikroorganismen, Braunschweig, FRG.
